title: gatotsu_stance
body: A specific attack stance used by [[Saitou Hajime (Rurouni Kenshin)|Saitou Hajime]] in the anime series [[Rurouni Kenshin]]. Used with a katana. The left arm is held back, blade held parallel to the ground, while the right arm is stretched forward and the right hand's fingers barely touching the tip of the blade.

title: maps
body:
MAPS "is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Hasegawa Yuichi. It was serialized in the Gakken magazine Monthly Comic Nora from 1985 to 1994. The series was adapted into two anime original video animations (OVAs): the 1987 original, fully titled Maps: Densetsu no Samayoeru Seijintachi (マップス 伝説のさまよえる星人たち?, lit. "Maps: Legendary Space Wanderers") in Japan, and the 1994 remake, simply titled Maps." [1]

title: hitohira
body:
ひとひら, lit. [i]Petal[/i] is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Kirihara Izumi]]. The story revolves around a shy girl named [[Asai Mugi]] who is unsure of what club to join in her school, but before she knows it she gets dragged into the Drama Research Society and becomes a member. The manga was first serialized in the Japanese seinen manga magazine Comic High! on March 22, 2004, and is published by Futabasha. It also had a twelve episodes anime adaptation which is aired in Japan between March 28, 2007 and June 13, 2007. 

h4. Characters

title: hidamari_no_pinyu
body:
陽だまりのピニュ, lit. [i]Sunshine Pinyu[/i] is Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Kogawa Misaki that was serialized in the Gangan POWERED between 2003 and 2009 and has been collected in five tankōbon volumes.

One morning Minato misses her bus to school after running into a pretty girl who seems lost and can barely speak Japanese. Later she runs into her in the street and she's filthy, but she's carrying a locket with a picture of Minato's grandfather in it, and this strange girl knows Minato's real name of Minuantte. She calls herself Pignuert and is looking for... A groom??!
Just who is this girl?

h4. Characters

* [[Pignuert Tipal Tipal-lu]], lit. [i]The one who is blessed by the kingdom, Pignuert.[/i]
* [[Hibina Minato]]
* [[Kuji Shoubu]]
* [[Tori Mono Norre Nona]], lit. [i]The son of the Norre house who lives in the Nona region, Tori.[/i]

h4.External links

* Wikipedia(JP): "Hidamari no Pinyu":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/陽だまりのピニュ
* Author's Website: http://kogawandering.blog.so-net.ne.jp/

title: hoshino_fumina
body:
Protagonist of [[Gundam Build Fighters Try]]. She wears several outfits in-series (aside from her Seihou uniform): one, a yellow jacket over a sports bra and bike shorts; second, a black and white cycling bodysuit; a blue jacket and a pair of yellow shorts; and a pink shirt over (presumably) her sports bra, white shorts, and black thigh-highs.

She is voiced by Makino Yui.

The gunpla she uses are the [[Powered GM Cardigan]], [[Winning Gundam]], and [[Star Winning Gundam]]. 

A [[mecha musume]] / Armor Girls Project version of her exists in-universe, called the [[Super Fumina]], modeled by [[Sakai Minato]].

title: hourai_elixir
body: The Hourai Elixir (蓬莱の薬 Hourai no Kusuri) was created by [[Yagokoro Eirin]] using [[Houraisan Kaguya]]'s power of the manipulation of eternity. Anyone who drinks this forbidden elixir will cease to age, never become ill, and will never be able to die. One will be as frail and vulnerable as before, but every injury shall cease; critical injuries will be healed in a matter of days. Complete destruction results in complete restoration.

title: tsuki_no_iwakasa
body:
A servant of the emperor. He took the [[Hourai Elixir]], given to his master by [[Kaguya hime]] when she left to return to her home on the moon, to the top of a mountain and burned it as instructed by the emperor. The smoke from the burning still emerges from that mountain, now called Fujiyama
In [[Touhou]], he was apparently murdered by [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] in order for her to optain the Hourai Elixir so she can one day have her revenge against [[Houraisan Kaguya]].

title: operator-chan
body:
A /k/ meme that has reached ridiculous proportions.

Originally just a picture of an Operator (Delta force) soldier drawn by shino, 4chan looked upon the drawing and found her unabashed cheerfulness in the face of death and violence a fitting mascot for a website where GuP and gore threads share viewers, and proceeded to photoshop her into literally hundreds of different comics, cartoons, backgrounds and other images.

Formerly just another picture of a cute girl in military gear, the new "Operator-Chan" meme grew big enough that it was recognized by the official artist and several of his peers, imitated by a South Korean military reenactment group, painted onto South Korean APCs, and turned into a patch which you can buy at unlimitedpatchworks.com/ once it gets back in stock. (It has sold out six different times)


Recognized by official artist here: https://twitter.com/r_shughart/status/655668623663480832

title: misaki_otome
body:
Japanese: 御崎乙女 (みさき　おとめ) [Misaki Otome]

Original character of [[nakano_futaba]], for "世回転界クロジカル (よかいけんたいくろじかる)" AKA "World-Rolling Black Logical" under series name 空狂少女 (からくりしょうじょ / [[karakuri_shoujo|Karakuri Shoujo]]), also written as "カラクリガールシリーズ [Karakuri Girls Series]". 

"Profile image":/posts/2554444

Information comes from her profile on "Uchi no Ko-Mato":https://www.uchinokomato.me/chara/show/3993 (stands for うちの子まと/うちのこまとめ [Uchi no Ko Matome]):

h4.Profile 

* [b]Quote[/b]: I thought it was fate
* [b]Name in Furigana[/b]: みさき　おとめ (Misaki Otome)
* [b]Works Appeared In:[/b] World-Rolling Black Logical
* [b]Age[/b]: 18 (third year in high school)
* [b]Birthday[/b]: July 7th
* [b]Gender[/b]: Female
* [b]Blood Type[/b]: O
* [b]Height[/b]: 176cm
* [b]Weight[/b]: 60kg
* [b]First-person pronoun (personal pronoun)[/b]: watashi / 私
* [b]Second-person pronouns (referring to others)[/b]: kimi / 君, [Name]-chan / 名前(ちゃん)

h4.Background

Main character. Black hair, dark eyes (highlight color depends on the ambient light). 
An extremely happy-go-lucky, carefree personality, optimistic. 
Being gentlemanly, she can't leave troubled girls alone; a gentlewoman who wants to make them happy. A lady-killer. 
A bit theatrical/dramatic, she is the type of person to use smug pick-up lines without hesitation. 

"I can't leave a troubled girl alone, can I?" 

With both a manly mind and body, there's hardly any traces of femininity in her. There are lots of cases where people mistake her gender upon first meeting her (generally they are able to tell by her huge boobs). 
Since she herself is also not very aware of her gender, she feels uncomfortable when people treat her like a girl. 

Without being concerned with particulars, she makes passes at any girl that catches her eye and goes out with them one after the other. 
The tone of her voice is androgynous. 

"C'mon, it's fine isn't it, if you become mine, just for a little bit" 
[tn]Tweaked it to make it sound a little more natural, feel free to re-tweak.[/tn]

She fell in love with first sight when she met [[sekai_(karakuri_shoujo)|Sekai]]. At first, she had a hard time with Sekai being unable to read between the lines. Once she is able to convey her thoughts to her, they become clingy love birds. 
(Nevertheless, her wavering towards other girls doesn't diminish)

Since she's handsome, she's popular.
Because she's well-aware of her own superiority, there is a part of her that is narcissistic and self-centered.
There isn't really anything she's fussed about being the best at in particular, but she's the type that wants to be superior at something or other. 

Having nerves of steel, no matter what, she is impressed with everything. Without thinking of the consequences, she's a go-getter that relentlessly butts into things. She is the type that will die quickly. 

Despite being a human, she is invulnerable. Even with wounds or on the verge of death, she has a physical constitution that heals her on the spot without leaving any wounds.
Her sense of pain is generally about average, so though she does heal herself, she openly dislikes being wounded. 
"I thought I was gonna die" is her catchphrase. In reality, she did. 

According to [[lilian_(karakuri_shoujo)|Lilian]] — she is a human who loves Sekai. (She also says she's got some hefty "plot armor":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlotArmor)
Because of that, she is rough about everything and no matter what happens, thinks she'll "be able to manage somehow or another". 

She is aware of her pushiness due to her selfish greed, and deprecates herself saying "I'm not a good person in the least". 
Regarding her relationships with women, bluntly put, she's trash. 

[spoiler]
She is the reincarnation of "Sora":https://www.uchinokomato.me/chara/show/12786. Her constitution is the result of a "curse" in her past life.
As a human who has cut off her negative mindset, it's as though there is no such thing as "despair". 
A person who would enjoy themselves up till they die.
[/spoiler]

She likes girls, Sekai, and wide open places where you can look out at the sky. 
Her dislikes/weaknesses are complicated things, things she's worried about, and formal, ceremonious things.

body:

This tag should be used to represent any note with an x instead of the bulb part of the note.

title: touno_kyouko
body:
Character from the 2017 original anime [[Seiren]]. 

Has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long-ish]] [[black hair]]. She also wears a yellow [[cardigan]].

From "the early character reveals on ANN":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-11-25/seiren-original-anime-reveals-3-more-cast-members-character-designs/.109183 :
[quote]
ANN said:
A "childhood friend who acts like a student at a girls' middle school." She has been the childhood friend of the protagonist since kindergarten, and they used to play together at a park at the top of the hill. She is an honor student in class 1-A who has excellent grades. On the other hand, she also loves shoujo manga and can also act a bit childish, and has a complex about the two sides of herself.
[/quote]

She is voiced by Kimura Juri.

title: hiyama_miu
body:
Character from the 2017 original anime [[Seiren]]. 

Has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[messy hair|messy]] light [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with long [[sidelocks]]. She wears no cardigan, only a simple [[white shirt]] and [[necktie]].

From "the early character reveals on ANN":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-11-25/seiren-original-anime-reveals-3-more-cast-members-character-designs/.109183 :
[quote]
ANN said:
An "elite girls' high school swimming club member." She is in class 2-D at Sakuragawa Higashi Girls' High School, a high-class school. She is ignorant of the ways of the world. She has always attended a girls' school, so she is jealous of those who go to co-ed schools.
[/quote]

She is voiced by Izawa Shiori.

title: miyamae_tooru
body:
Character from the 2017 original anime [[Seiren]]. 

Has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], uneven dark [[brown hair]]. She wears a grey [[cardigan]].

From "the early character reveals on ANN":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-11-25/seiren-original-anime-reveals-3-more-cast-members-character-designs/.109183 :
[quote]
ANN said:
A "critical upperclassman." She is in class 3-A at Teruhi Higashi High School. She loves video games, and her skill is at the level where she competes in tournaments. She is good with her hands and her hobby is to make original goods. She isn't very good at talking to others, and has a hard time continuing conversations with people who don't share her hobbies.
[/quote]

She is voiced by Shimoji Shino.

title: kiyomizu_ameko
body:
[b]Ameko Kiyomizu (清水 雨子)[/b]
[i]Miserable Rain Maker[/i]

An ame-onna and the stage 2 boss of the [[Touhou]] fangame concept, "Reawakening of Youkai Mountain". Her ability is causing rain to fall, but her self-appointed ability is causing miracles. 

She has light [[blue skin]], [[short hair|short]], [[blue hair]] and wears a rain hat with a [[blue ribbon]] on top.  She wears a blue [[raincoat]] and an umbrella-shaped [[skirt]] with a [[raindrop print]] pattern on it. She also wears rain boots and is usually seen carrying a blue [[umbrella]]. 

She is good friends with the [[chimera]] [[tsukumogami]] Asahi Nagashirokawa, and they can both be found frequenting a place known as the Monochrome Forest.

title: bruce_lee's_jumpsuit
body:
The distinctive [[yellow bodysuit|yellow jumpsuit]] [[Bruce Lee]]'s character wears in the film [[Game of Death]].

Given its common Danbooru association with the female character [[Huang Baoling]], this tag could also refer to the [i]very[/i] similar track suit worn by [[Beatrix Kiddo]] in the movie [[Kill Bill]]. There are slight differences - in both females' case, the pant leg ends straight, rather than tapering tightly around the ankle; also, the ladies' outfits feature a more prominent collar.

title: siscon
body:
Siblings (brothers or sisters) acting in extreme fashions towards their sisters.

This would include...

* Acting perverted toward their sister
* Acting in an extremely proud fashion towards their sister
* Siblings known for either of the above acting in collusion with others noted for the same behavior, even across different copyrights
* All of the above would also include sibling-like relationships, even if there is no actual blood relation
** [b]Example:[/b] [[Gertrud Barkhorn]] towards [[Miyafuji Yoshika]]

It would not incude...

* Mutual love, i.e. [[incest]] and/or [[yuri]]/[[hetero]]

title: shared_scarf
body:
A [[scarf]] worn by at least two persons. Sharing a scarf usually means at least mutuality between the wearers.

On pixiv, the tag "二人マフラー":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BA%8C%E4%BA%BA%E3%83%9E%E3%83%95%E3%83%A9%E3%83%BC (couple muffler) is used when exactly two people are sharing a scarf together. Otherwise, the tag "連マフラー":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E9%80%A3%E3%83%9E%E3%83%95%E3%83%A9%E3%83%BC (group muffler) is used on pixiv to denote images where a single scarf is used by 3 or more people.

"あったかあったか":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%82%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E3%81%8B%E3%81%82%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E3%81%8B is a reference to a particular scene in K-ON! Episode 7 "Christmas!" where [[Hirasawa Yui]] notices her sister [[Hirasawa Ui]] is missing her scarf and "she decides to share half of her scarf with her":[http://k-on.wikia.com/wiki/File:Yui_and_sis.png].

title: grailquest
body:
A series of [[gamebook]]s by J.H. Brennan. 
It was published in Japan from 1985 to 1987 by Futami Shobou"[1]":[/wiki_pages/36171#dtext-external-links] under the title "Dragon Fantasy Series." 

A guy who was working at Futami at the same time, handled that edition's illustrations using the pen name of HUGO HALL"[2]":[/wiki_pages/36171#dtext-external-links]. His impressive [[graphite_(medium)|graphite]] artworks were well-received, and there are enthusiastic fans even today. The most popular was the Poetic Fiend, which was modeled on Klaus Nomi"[3]":[/wiki_pages/36171#dtext-external-links]. 
He has stated that because the editor-in-charge was unwilling to pay the copyright royalties for the original illustrations of John Higgins"[4]":[/wiki_pages/36171#dtext-external-links], the editor asked him to do them because he just happened to be close by. Moreover, it seems that because the illustrations were for foreign books, in order to create a certain tone he made sure to use a foreign type of PN. He is currently active as an illustrator, tabletop game designer, and game book writer. 

Additionally, a message from the author to his Japanese readers was published in "Voyage of Terror" ~You can add 5 life points to this adventure, but in exchange 'You are forbidden from using judo or karate against the monsters that you encounter.' ~ 

Soudosha"[5]":[/wiki_pages/36171#dtext-external-links] began republishing the Japanese translation in 2004 using the original title of "グレイルクエスト".

h4.Characters

* [[pip_(grailquest)|Pip]]
* [[Excalibur Junior]]
* [[Merlin]]

h4#external-links.External links

[1] Wikipedia(JP): "Futami Shobou":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%8C%E8%A6%8B%E6%9B%B8%E6%88%BF
[2] http://twitter.com/GotoHugo
[3] Wikipedia: "Klaus Nomi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Klaus_Nomi
[4] Wikipedia: "John Higgins (comics)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Higgins_%28comics%29
[5] Wikipedia(JP): "Soudosha":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%89%B5%E5%9C%9F%E7%A4%BE

* Wikipedia: "Grailquest":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grailquest 
* HUGO HALL's webpage: http://hall.fool.jp/

title: esparks
body:
エスパークス (Esparks, written as E/P in some stories) is the name of a long-running stationery series sold by San-X"[1]":[/wiki_pages/38956#dtext-external-links] from 1989 to 1995, as well as [[esparks_(character))|the name of a superhero]] appearing the stories. 

The B5 size notebooks, central product of the line, was mainly composed of full-color manga by Soya Hiroshi"[1]":[/wiki_pages/38956#dtext-external-links] and mini-games like mazes and sugoroku inserted into the story. Other products like metal [[pencil case]]s, [[pencil]]s, [[eraser]]s and [[shitajiki]] also included additional stories, hints about the stories and mini-games, and alternatives for dice to be used in the games, which could be collected to see the full story. 

The sweeping story of the adventures of Esparks and his sidekick, a white monkey named [[Kiisuke]], through space and time to preserve peace on Terra, the charming characters and, most of all, the ability to read the manga while at school without technically breaking any rules made it a popular product line, spawning two video games and two "true" manga adaptations. A total of nine story arcs (sometimes referred to as 12 series, depending on the method of counting) were sold, with some that offered multiple endings. 

The Esparks boom and production of the series ended abruptly, but in 2008, about 20 years after the start of the series, the staff reunited and set up an official website and staff blog"[1]":[/wiki_pages/38956#dtext-external-links].

h4.Characters 

* [[esparks_(character)|Esparks]] 
* [[Kiisuke]] 
* [[King Hagaeru III]]

title: papa_no_iu_koto_wo_kikinasai!
body:
パパのいうことを聞きなさい!, a.k.a. [i]Listen to Me, Girls. I am Your Father![/i] or, literally, [i]Listen to what papa says![/i]. Called "Papakiki" for short.

A 2009-current light novel series by Matsu Tomohiro, with illustrations by [[Nakajima Yuka]], published under Shueisha's Super Dash Bunko imprint. Also adapted into a 2011-current manga, with illustrations by [[Takemura Youhei]], serialized in Shueisha's [i]Jump SQ[/i], and a 2012 anime by feel.

Nineteen-year-old college freshman Segawa Yuuta receives news of his older sister Yuri's disappearance together with her husband on a plane flight, leaving their three daughters - [[Takanashi Sora]], [[takanashi_miu|Miu]] and [[takanashi_hina|Hina]], of which Sora and Miu are from different mothers - to be distributed among his relatives. Unwilling to let these closely-knit half-sisters be separated, he steps in and becomes their legal guardian.

h4. Characters

* [[Oda Raika]]
* [[Segawa Yuuta]]
* [[Takanashi Hina]]

title: ipod_touch
body:
An [[ipod|iPod]] with a touch screen feature. Visually similar to the [[iPhone]] except for:
* The absence of the phone speaker above the screen.
* The location of the earphone jack, which has always been at the bottom. The iPhone's, up until 4S, was at the top to accommodate the 30-pin connector slot, phone mouthpiece hole, and external speakers at the bottom. On the iPhone 5 and 6 lines, the size of the Lightning connector slot enabled the placement of the earphone jack at the bottom. The earphone jack is absent from the iPhone 7, instead included separately as a connector via the Lighting port.
* Size, with the introduction of the larger iPhone 6 line.

title: superwoman
body:
There are various characters who have called themselves Superwoman, but they are usually an older female counterpart of Superman as opposed to the younger one of [[Supergirl]]. 

Those that have called themselves Superwoman were [[Lois Lane]] (both a good and evil version), a gender-bent Superman, a future descendant of Superman's pal Jimmy Olsen, an obsessed Superman fan, and Lois Lane's sister. As Superwoman is an somewhat obscure character, the variation most commonly seen in fanart is a gender-bent Superman.

title: tsuji_renta
body:
Head of the School Carriers Department of The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology (MEXT) in [[Girls und Panzer]]. Voiced by "Kageura Daisuke":[https://myanimelist.net/people/10059/Daisuke_Kageura]. Sports [[black hair]] and [[glasses]].

[spoiler]Plans to close Oarai Girls Academy to save funding, setting off the events of the show. Serves as the antagonist in Der Film, where he reneges on his promise not to close Oarai.[/spoiler]

He is officially credited as 'an Official (役人)' in the anime, and his full name is currently contested whether if it's 辻廉太=Tsuji Renta(spin-off manga) or 辻康太=Tsuji Kouta(GuP movie and merchandise) since both are being used. 
Rumored to be named after "Tsuji Masanobu,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masanobu_Tsuji one of the worst generals of the IJA.
other_names: 役人(ガールズ&パンツァー)

title: shindere_shoujo_to_kodoku_na_shinigami
body:
シンデレ少女と孤独な死神, lit. [i]Shindere Girl and the Forlorn Death-God[/i]  is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Katou Yoshie]] that was published in GANGAN Online starting from September 2011.

Heroine of this story, Akira, 2nd year middle school student, lives on very peaceful island. Everyone from her class is childhood friend, yet another peaceful year has started with the same unchanged faces, or so they thought. That's when transfer student - Nishigami Matsushiro - appeared, and said those very heavy words "Everyone who get close to me will definitely die" but what does that mean!?

h4. Characters

* [[Wakanae Akira]]
* [[Nishigami Matsushirou]]

h4.External links

* Official Site: [s]h[/s][s]ttp://www.ganganonline.com/comic/shindere/index.html[/s] (Dead link)
* Author's Website: http://trzr.jutk.namaste.jp/
* Wikipedia(JP): "Shindere Shoujo to Kodoku na Shinigami":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/シンデレ少女と孤独な死神

title: dogwelder
body:
[b]Dogwelder[/b] is one member of the [[DC Comics]] super hero team, “Section 8”"[1]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links], who made their first appearance in the “Hitman” comics"[2]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links] by Garth Ennis"[3]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links] and John McCrea"[4]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links].

He dons a [[welding mask]] with his spot welder[b](*1)[/b], and carries around stray [[dog]] [[corpse|corpses]] and vanquishes evildoers by welding the dead dogs to their faces.
Never showing his true face or saying a word, it's hard to believe he's not a villain but one of the active heroes in Gotham City.

In Japan his popularity been on the rise ever since novelist and translator Kaihou Norimitsu"[5]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links] showed great admiration for the character through his twitter feed"[6]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links], calling Dogwelder "犬溶接マン ([i]Inu Yousetsu Man[/i])” (lit. Dog Welding Man).
At last, Kaihou's Japanese translation of the Hitman comics are set to go on sale in August of 2013"[7]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links].

These translations plan to use "Inu Yousetsu Man" as the official Japanese translated name"[8]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links] for Dogwelder. The news containing information on the publication of the translation reported with this convoluted expression, “Even the Japanese version will have Inu Yousetsu Man as Inu Yousetsu man!”"[9]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links]
(It's hasn't been since 1969, when the Hanna-Barbera cartoon "The [[Fantastic Four]] aired in Japan, that a super hero name has been changed in the Japanese version. At that time, the member names were "Goomuz", "Susie", "Fireboy", and "Gan-rock" ~ "gomu" and "gan" each mean rubber and rock in Japanese.)

[tn][b](*1)[/b] Some Japanese believe that he is holding an arc welder (or arc cutter)"[10]":[/wiki_pages/46621#dtext-external-links].
“Wait... where is the electrode?!”
“Hmm, maybe he's doing that welding with a kind of psionic power...”[/tn]

[b]Monster Collection[/b] (or [b]Mon Colle[/b] for short) is a trading card game developed by Group SNE"[1]":[/wiki_pages/48579#dtext-external-links]. Monster Collection was first published in 1997 by Fujimi Shobo"[2]":[/wiki_pages/48579#dtext-external-links]. In 2000, [i][b]Monster Collection 2[/b][/i] was released. title: iza!_to_iu_toki_no_goshinjutsu
body:
いざ!というときの護身術 ([i]Iza! to iu toki no Goshin-jutsu[/i], Self-Defense Arts in Case of Emergency)

A Japanese textbook for self defence, published by Natsumesha in 1994. The editorial supervisor was Shibata Kouichi, a deceased aikidō Master Instructor. The illustrations on page 62 and 63 of the book are known as a [[meme]] called 痴漢撃退法 ([i]Chikan Gekitai Hou[/i], How to Fend Off a Rapist). The book was illustrated by some obscure artists, and the illustrator of those particular pages is unknown. The book was reissued by Cosmic Shuppan in 2010 with the rewritten texts and illustrations.

title: postage_stamp
body:
A postage stamp is a small piece of paper that is purchased and displayed on an item of mail as evidence of payment of postage.
The stamp’s shape is usually that of a small rectangle of varying proportions, though triangles or other shapes are occasionally used.

Before the introduction of postage stamps, recipients were unable or unwilling to pay for delivered items, and senders had no incentive to restrict the number, size, or weight of items sent. The postage stamp resolved this issue in a simple and elegant manner, with the additional benefit of room for an element of beauty to be introduced.

h4. External Links

* Wikipedia: "Postage Stamp":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postage_stamp

title: merrybell_truth
body:
A character in the light novel [[transporter_(misutee)|Transporter]] by [[misutee]].

She has [[long hair]], which usually appears [[blue hair|blue]] or [[purple hair|purple]].

h4. Profile

From http://misticblue.selfish.be/tp/tp_c02merry.html

[quote]ロイヤルブルーを継ぐ帝国皇女。
正式の名前を隠し、姉を見習った
名前に変えている。帝国が解体
され、どこに向かい、誰を頼る
のか……時代の流れに翻弄され
ながらも気高く生きようとする。

基本的にゼイタク指向でわがまま。
だが、何も出来ない姫と言われる
ことがイヤでなんでもやってみせる
という意地をみせる。一途で健気な
面もあるが、他人に見せることは
少ない。姉ミストに対しては……。
[/quote]
other_names: メリーベル・トゥルース

[quote]カートの元・恋人。
想いを秘めるタイプだったが、
市民革命運動に身を投じ、活
発に自分の意見を言うように
なり、理想を追いかける。
だが、カートと次第に意見が
対立し、そしてカートの激務が
始まり、逢う機会が減った。

思い込みが激しく、力強い言葉に
弱い。苦しい生活をしていた時に
カートに買ってもらった革命軍
グッズを大切にしている。
[/quote]

title: khorloogiin_choibalsan
body:
The Communist leader of the Mongolian People's Republic and Marshal (general chief commander) of the Mongolian armed forces from the 1930s until his death in 1952. His rule marked the first and last time in modern Mongolian history that a single individual amassed complete political power. Often referred to as “the Stalin of Mongolia”, Choibalsan oversaw violent Soviet-ordered purges in the late 1930s that resulted in the deaths of an estimated 30,000 to 35,000 Mongolians. Most of the victims were Buddhist clergy, intelligentsia, political dissidents, ethnic Buryats and Kazakhs, and other "enemies of the revolution." His intense persecution of Mongolia's Buddhists brought about their near complete extinction in the country.

Although Choibalsan's devotion to Joseph Stalin helped preserve his country's fledgling independence during the early years of the Mongolian People's Republic (MPR), it also turned Mongolia into the first satellite state of the Soviet Union. Throughout his rule, Mongolia's economic, political, and military ties to the USSR deepened, infrastructure and literacy rates improved, and international recognition of Mongolia's independence expanded, especially after World War II.

title: nietzsche-sensei_konbini_ni_satori_sedai_no_shinjin_ga_maiorita
body:
Mr. Nietzsche in the Convenience Store (ニーチェ先生～コンビニに、さとり世代の新人が舞い降りた～ Nietzsche-sensei ~Konbini ni, Satori Sedai no Shinjin ga Maiorita~?) is a Japanese shōjo comedy manga series written by Matsukoma and illustrated by Hashimoto that was based off a popular series of Twitter posts detailing the lives of real-life convenience store employees.

Matsukoma and Hashimoto began publishing the manga in the August 2013 issue of Kadokawa's shōjo magazine Monthly Comic Gene.  An audio drama CD was released in February 2015 with a live-action television adaptation airing in 01 January 2016 that was simulcast on Crunchyroll.


Source:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr._Nietzsche_in_the_Convenience_Store

title: turntable
body:
A turntable is a modern [[phonograph]], also known as a record player or record machine. They are a popular machine commonly used by [[DJ|Disc Jockeys]]. Turntables are distinguished from older phonographs by the fact that they have electrical pickups instead of a purely mechanical one. 

[b]Note:[/b] If a phonograph is basically flat and has a mobile arm, it's probably a turntable. If it has a cone, or a tube-style fixed arm, it isn't.

title: split_tail
body:
For a [[monster girl]], such as a [[mermaid]] or [[lamia]] whose legs are fused into a tail, but only starting somewhere below the waist, leaving the thighs still separated at the top.  

At minimum, there must be enough room to run a string from front to back through the middle.  Having an [[ass]] or [[pussy|vagina]] alone isn't enough.

This is frequently part of an artist's attempt to solve the so-called "mermaid problem."

h4. See also
[[Forked Tail]] : One tail that splits into two around midway.

title: jihad_(novel)
body:
ジハード, lit. [i]Jihad[/i] is a historical novel series written by Sadakane Shinji that was first published by Jump J Books between 1993 and 2002 consisted of eleven volumes. 

The novel up to volume 5 was illustrated by [[Yamane Kazutoshi]] and the rest was illustrated by [[Shiba Minako]]. In 2003 the series was republished by Shueisha Bunko and condensed into 6 volumes. Starting from January 10, 2014 the series is republished again by Kodansha and is illustrated by [[Eihi]].

title: over_saturation
body:
Over saturation is the term for inappropriately intense colors in an image or video. This can be caused deliberately for artistic effect, as well.

A well-known example ("illustrated here" [s]h[/s][s]ttp://preservation.bavc.org/artifactatlas/index.php/Oversaturation[/s] (Dead link)) is when the reds on a television set come through too strongly, resulting in unusual skin tones.

title: hoshi_meguru
body:
A magical girl in [i][[Mahou Shoujo Taisen]][/i] representing [[Iwate prefecture]].
 
She was originally created by [[Mukaida Kaoru]] as part of the [[Mahou Shoujo_Taisen_contest 1|first Mahou Shoujo Taisen Contest]] and won an Award of Excellence. In that post, Mukaida called her Clammbon (クラムボン). This is from a famous short story by "Miyazawa Kenji":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenji_Miyazawa, who was born in Iwate.

h4. Profile

title: kawashima_michiyuki
body:
The lead vocalist and guitarist for the Japanese electronic music duo Boom Boom Satellites, who passed away on October 9, 2016. The band performed the theme song for [[Kiznaiver]], titled "Lay Your Hands on Me".

[quote]【To everyone who has supported BOOM BOOM SATELLITES over the years】

It is our sad duty to inform you that Michiyuki Kawashima of BOOM BOOM SATELLITES passed away at 5:12am on October 9th, 2016, after his continued battle with brain tumor.

We offer our sincerest appreciation to everyone who supported BOOM BOOM SATELLITES and Michiyuki Kawashima over the years.

The wake and funeral will be held privately for family and close friends, with a farewell event for fans at a later date. Details will be posted on the band's website.

【Comment from Masayuki Nakano of BOOM BOOM SATELLITES】

At 5:12am on October 9th, BOOM BOOM SATELLITES's vocalist Michiyuki Kawashima set off on the next stage of his journey.
I imagine he is soaring around the world, finally freed from the restrictions of his body. His passing is not a tragedy, but the achievement of a lifetime goal and a happy ending. The love of our many fans supported Michiyuki Kawashima and BOOM BOOM SATELLITES on their journey, and we are truly happy and lucky because of you.
On behalf of Michiyuki Kawashima, I would like to thank all our fans and colleagues again.

"Thank you for supporting us up until now. Live your lives with passion and energy and keep the music we made, the time we spent together, and the memories we shared close to you."

“One more thing, we are BOOM BOOM SATELLITES!!”

Masayuki Nakano[/quote]

title: surfboard_(wrestling)
body: Also called the "Mexican Surfboard", this move is a painful [[submission hold]] in which one wrestler hooks their legs around an opponent's legs from behind in such a way that the wrestler's feet are pressed against the back of the opponent's knees, and then grabs their wrists before rolling into a seated position or on their back and lifting the opponent off the ground and compressing their shoulder blades. This move is also known as [i]La Tapatia[/i] or the "Romero Special", due to its invention by [i]luchador[/i] Rito Romero.

title: occult_ball
body:
オカルトボール

Special items appearing as the focus of [i][[Urban Legend in Limbo]][/i]. They look like dark-purple orbs made of some reflective glass-like material.
[spoiler]They are actually "Power Stones" coming from the various power-spots of the world, and were used by [[Usami Sumireko|Sumireko Usami]] to tear a hole in the Hakurei Barrier and enter in Gensokyo. They are also the cause for the appearance of the urban legends in Gensokyo. 
Apparently, one of them comes not from the Outside World, but from the Lunar Capital, making it an extremely dangerous object to have and use.[/spoiler]

In [i][[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]][/i], it is revealed [spoiler][[Kishin Sagume|Sagume Kishin]] was the one who responsible for creation of these orbs.[/spoiler]

title: ryoune_yami
body:
Ryoune Yami is an [[otoko no ko]] [[UTAU]] voicebank & character, voiced by [[Kiki (tsunya)]].

His design is taken from the /cm/ board of [[4chan]]'s genderswapped/trap version of the "Ecstasy AKA Darks" [[meme]]. Said meme originated from 4chan's /a/ board back in 2007. The original image of Darks was an image of someone's self-insert original character posted on DeviantArt, said image depicted a poorly-drawn generic emo boy with blue-dyed black hair and a small list of his likes (Blood, Death, Knives, Psycos, Pointy objects, Green Day, and staying up all night), dislikes (Peace and love), age (13), and height (5"2). 

A copy of the original image can be found "here":[http://i.imgur.com/fZxYVxY.jpg].

Sometime in 2010, someone took /cm/'s super kawaii version of Darks and turned him into a Vocaloid trap. He retained most of his characteristics but was given a different name so that trolls wouldn't find him. He dresses up as a girl, does covers of songs using his own UTAU sound bank, and has buttsex with other fan-made UTAUs for the amusement of young yaoi fangirls on DeviantArt.

This page and tag on danbooru is for the created UTAU.

h4. External links

* Official pages:
** http://yamitan.blogspot.jp/
** http://ryoneyami.weebly.com/
** http://ryoneyami.blog.fc2.com/
* "UTAU Wiki: Yami-Ryone":http://utau.wiki/utau:yami-ryone
* "Nicopedia: 竜音闇":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4889259
* "Encyclopedia Dramatica: Ecstasy AKA Darks":https://encyclopediadramatica.se/Ecstasy_AKA_Darks

title: irekawari_no_sono_hate_ni
body:
Irekawari no Sono Hate ni is a Japanese light novel series written by Yunari. It was first published as web novels in 2010 and then published as light novels by Alphapolis in 2012 with illustration by [[sarai|Risu]].

Tachikawa Yukako, a 33 years old office lady, found herself summoned to the Kingdom of Lior in another world and got her appearance altered to replace the dead Princess Michella who was assassinated. Now, she has to deal with all the trouble that life in the palace brings while trying to find a way to go back to her own world before she is sent off to marry the prince of a neighboring kingdom.

h4. See Also

* "Original Web Novel Page":http://yunari1.web.fc2.com/novel/title_01.html "[2]" [s]h[/s][s]ttp://ncode.syosetu.com/n4535k/[/s] (Dead link)

title: schick
body:
"Schick is a brand of safety razors that is part of the personal care division of Energizer Holdings. The company was founded in 1926 and was purchased by Energizer in 2003 from Pfizer. ... While second in sales to Gillette globally, Schick is the top selling brand of safety razors and blades in Japan." [1]


h4. Schick x [i]Neon Genesis Evangelion[/i]
Schick has been running an ad campaign with [i][[Neon Genesis Evangelion]][/i] since at least 2012. See the following:

title: ginkou_kishidan
body:
銀光騎士団 ─フロストナイツ─   (Ginkou Kishidan -Frost Knights-)
A light novel by Suzuki Hisashi (スズキヒサシ) and illustrations by [[ran'ou (tamago no kimi)]].

h4. Backstory
From "Amazon":http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/404866378X
[quote]流れ者の青年アスペルはもめ事に巻き込まれた際に、ひとりの少年と知り合う。リュシアンと名乗る彼は、少年とは思えないほどの愛らしさの中に、ただ者ではない気品を感じさせた。汚い奇妙な風体とは裏腹に、時おり油断ならない身のこなしを見せるアスペル。その腕を見込まれてか、リュシアンにつきまとわれることに、だが、このリュシアンの供がまた普通ではない。鋭い目つきの連中に訳ありと見たアスペルは、関わらずに済まそうと思うのだが、すでに運命の大きな歯車は動きだしていた。それは栄光の代償に、血にまみれた道を歩むことを求めるものであり―。 [/quote]

title: souza_samonji
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character. Part of the Samonji school along with [[Sayo Samonji]] and [[Kousetsu Samonji]].


The actual sword was treated as a treasure by most of its owners, and never saw battle. As a result, Souza Samonji is extremely bitter about it, seeing that he felt like he was in a gilded cage for most of his life. His attitude towards the Saniwa also extends to this resentment, wryly asking them is they're going to treat him the same way. When he is broken, he states that he's finally free of his burdens. Despite this cynical mindset, he says it all with a smile.

title: congratu-rape
body:
A 2002 adult manga book by [[Matsurioka Hideyuki]]. It contains the second part of his lifework(?) adult gag manga, "Re-ken (Rape Research)" series.

A scene in the book (page 47) has been parodied as a kind of [[meme]]:
[quote]
Obata Batako: [b]ほほほほほ!![/b] 何をされてもあなたなんかにイカされはしないわ!!

([b]Ha ha ha ha ha![/b] No matter what you do, I won't come due to someone like you!!)

title: marivel_armitage
body:
Marivel (or Mariabelle in Japan) is a Crimson Noble (in Japan, ノーブルレッド "Noble Red") - a near-immortal vampire - in [i][[Wild Arms 2]][/i]. She is friends with [[Anastasia Valeria]], but is otherwise too scared to make friends because she outlives them. Marivel is a technological genius, controlling two robotic familiars named Hob and Nob, using the golem Quebley in battle, and fixing [[Kanon (Wild Arms 2)|Kanon]]'s cybernetics. Marivel can join the party as an optional character; while not needed for the story, her tools help unlock various extras that can't be accessed otherwise, including most of the optional boss battles.

While [[Mirabelle Graceland]]'s name and Crimson Noble race are the same as Marivel's, they are not the same character. 

Marivel also makes cameo appearances in [i][[Wild Arms 3]][/i] (not in person, but as a character in a serialized childrens' story that's found in books throughout the game) and [i][[Wild Arms 5|5]][/i].  Humorously, her cameo in [i]5[/i] is that of a black market dealer who sucks the characters' levels in exchange for rare items, living up to her vampiric origins. Marivel is also well known for being a terrible singer; she's so bad, she attracts monsters.

title: shuujin_(pageratta)
body:
The God of Chains from "Everyday with Gods":/pools/8741 series by [[pageratta]]. 
[tn]a.k.a. "Prisoner"[/tn]

God Power: 「Curse of Bondage」

Before becoming a god, he was called "The Jailbreak King of the Century". His stealing, jail-breaking and getaway skill are the best in both heaven and earth. Keeps a pet hell hound called "Hell boy" in Heaven. 
Jerkass with the heart of gold. Occasionally got chased by Warrior God due to being criminal by default.
He is obsessed with "binding" in many meanings - be it making or breaking including rules, bonds, restraints, cages, bondage (bdsm) and applying that either on himself or surroundings. This obsession and his God Power often make him do a deeds that turns out to be good in the end - that is outweighting his off-scene crimes and keeping his karma "neutral". Can break from any prison, binding and cage (even from tough one called "common sense"), but the he can't break from his bonds of a dog-lover. 

[i]Appearance:[/i] Short black hair, bristle. Yellow eyes, constricted pupils. Has thick lines on eyes' edges, making him look like he lacks a proper sleep or light form of "[[black eyes]]". His usual expression is scowling with grinning.
[i]Attire:[/i] Typical prisoner's attire - black-white striped clothes. Light-blue jacket with rolled up sleeves on top and number 24601 on it - from another type of prison clothes. Barefeet.
[i]Accesories:[/i] Chain necklace with golden hanglock as pendant. Occasionally seen with [[ball and chain restraint]] on leg.
[i]Halo:[/i] Golden bracelet on either of hand. The Prisoner uses it as [i]the bracelets[/i] to bind his hands.
